title: Liverpool's Sadio Mane worried he would not get along with Klopp as he 'was talking too much'
text:
Liverpool forward Sadio Mane has admitted he was initially concerned about his chemistry with manager Jurgen Klopp on their first meeting because the German 'talked too much'.

The 27-year-old has become one of the most dangerous players in the Premier League under the guidance of Klopp since arriving from Southampton in 2016 in a £34million deal.

Mane has added a clinical nature to his game as he helped the Reds finish second in the table last season, finishing as the joint-top goalscorer with 22 strikes as Liverpool also clinched the Champions League trophy.

Sadio Mane worried Jurgen Klopp was too much of a talker when the pair first met in 2014

Under the management of Klopp, Mane has upped his game and been in lethal form at Anfield

But while the Senegalese star and Klopp have formed a great understanding on and off the pitch, Mane has conceded that he initially had doubts that the two would get along after their first meeting as the former Dortmund boss was much louder than he was.

'He was talking too much and I said, "Wow, this is going to be tough for me because I'm a little quiet",' he said, speaking to the Sunday Times.

The pair first met before Mane's big move to Anfield - two years earlier when he was a Red Bull Salzburg player and Klopp was still with Dortmund.

The forward nets the first opener in a Champion League tie against his former team Salzburg

The German Giants were attempting to snare Mane from the Austrian side in 2014, but after they got talking, he soon realised that Klopp was 'a really nice guy'.

He added: 'Everybody loves him and that is more important, to be honest [than all the talking]. He is a bit of a funny guy but at the same time he is a serious guy.'

Now Mane is leading the charge for Liverpool as they bid to claim their first Premier League crown for 30 years, and the player has hailed the effect his manager has had on him.

'Usually when I am talking to him off the pitch it is about personal things. Things about lifestyle and life - and that is important to me. I think I have somebody I can confide in.'
description: The 27-year-old has become one of the most dangerous players in the Premier League under the guidance of Klopp since arriving from Southampton in 2016 in a £34million deal.
